title: Semiclassical Hodge theory for log Poisson manifolds
abstract:
We construct a mixed Hodge structure on the topological K-theory of smooth
Poisson varieties, depending weakly on a choice of compactification. We
establish a package of tools for calculations with these structures, such as
functoriality statements, projective bundle formulae, Gysin sequences and
Torelli properties. We show that for varieties with trivial A-hat class, the
corresponding period maps for families can be written as exponential maps for
bundles of tori, which we call the "quantum parameters". As justification for
the terminology, we show that in many interesting examples, the quantum
parameters of a Poisson variety coincide with the parameters appearing in its
known deformation quantizations. In particular, we give a detailed
implementation of an argument of Kontsevich, to prove that his canonical
quantization formula, when applied to Poisson tori, yields noncommutative tori
with parameter "$q = e^\hbar$".
